data.title: The Princess Bride (1987)
data.summary: While home sick in bed, a young boy's grandfather reads him a story called The Princess Bride.

data.title: Wonder (I) (2017)
data.summary: Based on the New York Times bestseller, this movie tells the incredibly inspiring and heartwarming story of August Pullman, a boy with facial differences who enters the fifth grade, attending a mainstream elementary school for the first time.

data.title: The Wizard of Oz (1939)
data.summary: Dorothy Gale is swept away from a farm in Kansas to a magical land of Oz in a tornado and embarks on a quest with her new friends to see the Wizard who can help her return home to Kansas and help her friends as well.

data.title: The Sound of Music (1965)
data.summary: A woman leaves an Austrian convent to become a governess to the children of a Naval officer widower.

data.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban (2004)
data.summary: It's Harry's third year at Hogwarts; not only does he have a new "Defense Against the Dark Arts" teacher, but there is also trouble brewing. Convicted murderer Sirius Black has escaped the Wizards' Prison and is coming after Harry.

data.title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey (2012)
data.summary: A reluctant Hobbit, Bilbo Baggins, sets out to the Lonely Mountain with a spirited group of dwarves to reclaim their mountain home, and the gold within it from the dragon Smaug.

data.title: My Fair Lady (1964)
data.summary: A snobbish phonetics professor agrees to a wager that he can take a flower girl and make her presentable in high society.

data.title: E.T. the Extra-Terrestrial (1982)
data.summary: A troubled child summons the courage to help a friendly alien escape Earth and return to his home world.

data.title: The Goonies (1985)
data.summary: In order to save their home from foreclosure, a group of misfits set out to find a pirate's ancient valuable treasure.

data.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire (2005)
data.summary: A young wizard finds himself competing in a hazardous tournament between rival schools of magic, but he is distracted by recurring nightmares.

data.title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows: Part 1 (2010)
data.summary: As Harry races against time and evil to destroy the Horcruxes, he uncovers the existence of three most powerful objects in the wizarding world: the Deathly Hallows.

data.title: Stardust (2007)
data.summary: In a countryside town bordering on a magical land, a young man makes a promise to his beloved that he'll retrieve a fallen star by venturing into the magical realm.

data.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone (2001)
data.summary: An orphaned boy enrolled in a school of wizardry, where he learns the truth about himself, his family and the terrible evil that haunts the magical world.

data.title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince (2009)
data.summary: As Harry Potter begins his sixth year at Hogwarts, he discovers an old book marked as "the property of the Half-Blood Prince" and begins to learn more about Lord Voldemort's dark past.

data.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix (2007)
data.summary: With their warning about Lord Voldemort's return scoffed at, Harry and Dumbledore are targeted by the Wizard authorities as an authoritarian bureaucrat slowly seizes power at Hogwarts.

data.title: Home Alone (1990)
data.summary: An eight-year-old troublemaker must protect his house from a pair of burglars when he is accidentally left home alone by his family during Christmas vacation.

data.title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)
data.summary: The adventures of writer Newt Scamander in New York's secret community of witches and wizards seventy years before Harry Potter reads his book in school.

data.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets (2002)
data.summary: Harry ignores warnings not to return to Hogwarts, only to find the school plagued by a series of mysterious attacks and a strange voice haunting him.

data.title: The Jungle Book (2016)
data.summary: After a threat from the tiger Shere Khan forces him to flee the jungle, a man-cub named Mowgli embarks on a journey of self discovery with the help of panther Bagheera and free-spirited bear Baloo.

data.title: I Can Only Imagine (2018)
data.summary: The inspiring and unknown true story behind MercyMe's beloved, chart topping song that brings ultimate hope to so many is a gripping reminder of the power of true forgiveness.

data.title: The NeverEnding Story (1984)
data.summary: A troubled boy dives into a wondrous fantasy world through the pages of a mysterious book.

data.title: Beauty and the Beast (2017)
data.summary: A selfish prince is cursed to become a monster for the rest of his life, unless he learns to fall in love with a beautiful young woman he keeps prisoner.

data.title: The Karate Kid (1984)
data.summary: A martial arts master agrees to teach karate to a bullied teenager.

data.title: Alpha (2018)
data.summary: In the prehistoric past, a young man struggles to return home after being separated from his tribe during a buffalo hunt. He finds a similarly lost wolf companion, and starts a friendship that would change humanity.

data.title: Maleficent (2014)
data.summary: A vengeful fairy is driven to curse an infant princess, only to discover that the child may be the one person who can restore peace to their troubled land.

data.title: A Dog's Purpose (2017)
data.summary: A dog looks to discover his purpose in life over the course of several lifetimes and owners.

data.title: Cinderella (I) (2015)
data.summary: When her father unexpectedly passes away, young Ella finds herself at the mercy of her cruel stepmother and her scheming step-sisters. Never one to give up hope, Ella's fortunes begin to change after meeting a dashing stranger.

data.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe (2005)
data.summary: Four kids travel through a wardrobe to the land of Narnia and learn of their destiny to free it with the guidance of a mystical lion.

data.title: Matilda (1996)
data.summary: Story of a wonderful little girl, who happens to be a genius, and her wonderful teacher vs. the worst parents ever and the worst school principal imaginable.

data.title: Jumanji (1995)
data.summary: When two kids find and play a magical board game, they release a man trapped for decades in it and a host of dangers that can only be stopped by finishing the game.

data.title: The 5,000 Fingers of Dr. T. (1953)
data.summary: A young boy travels to an imaginary world where, assisted by his family's plumber, he must save other piano playing kids like himself from the dungeons of his dictatorial piano teacher who also mind-controls his mother.

data.title: Hocus Pocus (1993)
data.summary: After three centuries, three witch sisters are resurrected in Salem, Massachusetts on Halloween night, and it is up to two teenagers, a young girl, and an immortal cat to put an end to their reign of terror once and for all.

data.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory (2005)
data.summary: A young boy wins a tour through the most magnificent chocolate factory in the world, led by the world's most unusual candy maker.

data.title: Tomorrowland (2015)
data.summary: Bound by a shared destiny, a teen bursting with scientific curiosity and a former boy-genius inventor embark on a mission to unearth the secrets of a place somewhere in time and space that exists in their collective memory.

data.title: The Parent Trap (1998)
data.summary: Identical twins Annie and Hallie, separated at birth and each raised by one of their biological parents, later discover each other for the first time at summer camp and make a plan to bring their wayward parents back together.

data.title: Little Giants (1994)
data.summary: Misfits form their own opposing team to an elite peewee football team, coached by the elite team coach's brother.

data.title: Sky High (2005)
data.summary: Set in an era where superheroes are commonly known and accepted, young William Stronghold, the son of the Commander and Jetstream, tries to find a balance between being a normal teenager and an extraordinary being.

data.title: A-X-L (2018)
data.summary: A.X.L. is a top-secret, robotic dog who develops a special friendship with Miles and will go to any length to protect his new companion.

data.title: Scooby-Doo (2002)
data.summary: After an acrimonious break up, the Mystery Inc. gang are individually brought to an island resort to investigate strange goings on.

data.title: A Wrinkle in Time (2018)
data.summary: After the disappearance of her scientist father, three peculiar beings send Meg, her brother, and her friend to space in order to find him.

data.title: Show Dogs (2018)
data.summary: Max, a macho, solitary Rottweiler police dog is ordered to go undercover as a primped show dog in a prestigious Dog Show, along with his human partner, to avert a disaster from happening.

data.title: Fantastic Beasts: The Crimes of Grindelwald (2018)
data.summary: The second installment of the "Fantastic Beasts" series set in J.K. Rowling's Wizarding World featuring the adventures of magizoologist Newt Scamander.

data.title: The House with a Clock in Its Walls (2018)
data.summary: A young orphan named Lewis Barnavelt aids his magical uncle in locating a clock with the power to bring about the end of the world.

data.title: The Nutcracker and the Four Realms (2018)
data.summary: A young girl is transported into a magical world of gingerbread soldiers and an army of mice.

data.title: Mary Poppins Returns (2018)
data.summary: In Depression-era London, a now-grown Jane and Michael Banks, along with Michael's three children, are visited by the enigmatic Mary Poppins following a personal loss. Through her unique ...                See full summary »

data.title: Goosebumps 2: Haunted Halloween (2018)
data.summary: Halloween comes to life in a comedy adventure based on R.L. Stine's 400-million-selling series of books.

data.title: Aladdin (2019)
data.summary: A live-action retelling of the 1992 Disney film of the same name.

data.title: Little Women (2018)
data.summary: A modern retelling of Louisa May Alcott's classic novel, we follow the lives of four sisters - Meg, Jo, Beth, and Amy March - detailing their passage from childhood to womanhood. Despite ...                See full summary »

data.title: Dora the Explorer (2019)
data.summary: A young explorer embarks on an adventure.

data.title: Mulan (2020)
data.summary: A young Chinese maiden disguises herself as a male warrior in order to save her father. A live-action feature film based on Disney's 'Mulan.'
